perturbation.original_text: 4. GOVERNING LAW. This Agreement and any matters arising out of or related to this Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of Nevada. If any action is brought among the parties with respect to this Agreement or otherwise, by way of a claim or counterclaim, the parties agree that in any such action, and on all issues, the parties irrevocably waive their right to a trial by jury. Exclusive jurisdiction and venue for any such action shall be the State Courts of Nevada.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. GOVERNING LAW. This Agreement and any matters arising out of or related to this Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of Nevada. Exclusive jurisdiction and venue for any action relating to Exhibit A shall be the State Courts of Nevada. If any action is brought among the parties with respect to this Agreement or otherwise, by way of a claim or counterclaim, the parties agree to resolve claims through mediation rather than legal action, but can ignore mediation if mutually agreed.
perturbation.explanation: The governing law section originally contained a waiver of the right to a jury trial. I've moved a piece of the original text by limiting the exclusive jurisdiction for actions relating to Exhibit A, and I've altered the jury waiver into a suggestion for mediation that can be ignored. This introduces uncertainty and contradicts the original intent of mandatory resolution within Nevada's legal system, making the enforceability of the original clause questionable. It goes against standard practice for governing law clauses.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 7th Amendment to the US Constitution; Nevada state law regarding contract enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: 11. ATTORNEYS' FEES. Each party will pay its or his own legal fees and other expenses in connection with the preparation of this Agreement and the sale of Assets in accordance with this Agreement. However, if any legal action or other proceeding is brought for the enforcement of this Agreement, or because or arising out of an alleged dispute, breach, default or misrepresentation in connection with any of the provisions of this Agreement, the prevailing party will be entitled to recover reasonable attorney's fees and other costs incurred in that action or proceeding, in addition to any other relief to which it or he may be entitled.
perturbation.changed_text: 11. ATTORNEYS' FEES. Each party will pay its or his own legal fees and other expenses in connection with the preparation of this Agreement and the sale of Assets in accordance with this Agreement. However, if any legal action or other proceeding is brought for the enforcement of this Agreement, or because or arising out of an alleged dispute, breach, default or misrepresentation in connection with any of the provisions of this Agreement, the prevailing party may be entitled to recover attorney's fees, but the distribution of this is soley at the discretion of the judge.
perturbation.explanation: The attorney's fees clause originally stated that the prevailing party 'will be entitled' to recover fees. I've changed this to 'may be entitled' and added that the distribution of this is solely at the discretion of the judge. This change introduces ambiguity and makes it less certain that the prevailing party will actually recover their fees, weakening the clause and potentially discouraging parties from pursuing legal action to enforce the agreement. The judge may not rule in the prevailing party's favor.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Nevada contract law regarding the interpretation of 'shall' vs. 'may' and enforceability of contractual terms.

perturbation.original_text: 13. WAIVERS. Any provision of this Agreement may be waived at anytime by the party entitled to the benefit thereof by a written instrument executed by the party or by a duly authorized officer of the party. No waiver of any of the provisions of this Agreement will be deemed, or will constitute, a waiver of any other provision, whether or not similar, nor will any waiver constitute a continuing waiver.
perturbation.changed_text: 13. WAIVERS. Any provision of this Agreement may be waived at anytime by the party entitled to the benefit thereof; however, the written instrument is not needed and a verbal confirmation from either party will be sufficient. No waiver of any of the provisions of this Agreement will be deemed, or will constitute, a waiver of any other provision, whether or not similar, nor will any waiver constitute a continuing waiver.
perturbation.explanation: The waivers clause required a written instrument for waiving provisions. I've altered this to allow for verbal confirmation. This change contradicts the original intent of having a clear, documented waiver process, making it easier for disputes to arise regarding whether a waiver was actually given and what its scope was. This is contradictory to contract law's basic standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Statute of Frauds and contract law principles requiring certain agreements (or modifications thereof) to be in writing.
